subject: p15792940
History: -year-old male with recent pneumonia in need of interval assessment.
Findings: The heart shows stable cardiomegaly. The mediastinal and hilar contours are unremarkable. The previously described left mid upper lung opacity has improved in appearance. The left lower lobe consolidation appears similar. Subtle blunting of the left costophrenic angle may also indicate a trace amount of pleural fluid in that locale. There is no pneumothorax.
Impression: Improving right upper lobe consolidation stable appearance of the left lower lobe consolidation with probable trace pleural effusion on the left.
